The period of the Persian monarchie VVherein sundry places of Ezra, Nehemiah and Daniel are cleered: extracted, contracted, and englished, much of it out of Doctor Raynolds, by the late learned and godly man William Pemble, of Magdalen Hall in Oxford. Published and enlarged since his death by his friend, Richard Capel. Pemble, William, 1592?-1623. Capel, Richard, 1586-1656. Rainolds, John, 1549-1607.
[4], 84 p.
Printed by R. Y[oung] for Iohn Bartlet at the signe of the guilt Cup in Cheape-side in the Goldsmiths Row, London : 1631.
Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: Obscure Scriptures explained. Variant: title page line 13 omits "his friend". Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
=======

Published and enlarged since his death by his friend, Richard Capel. Pemble, William, 1592?-1623. Capel, Richard, 1586-1656. Rainolds, John, 1549-1607.

Printed by R. Y[oung] for Iohn Bartlet at the signe of the guilt Cup in Cheape-side in the Goldsmiths Row, London : 1631.
